title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: I came here last Saturday to the old home of my dear sister Evelyn Blantyre, who died at Nice, in '69, and where I have not been since her time, a quarter of a century ago. The day before I left Newbyth, Ellen Baird took me to Biel, a place belonging to the Ogilvies. The owner of Biel was the great heiress, Miss Baillie Hamilton, and Biel is one of her many homes.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: The day before I left Newbyth, Ellen Baird took me to Biel, a place belonging to the Ogilvies. The owner of Biel was the great heiress, Miss Baillie Hamilton, and Biel is one of her many homes. It stands in a valley, with fine terraces and fine timber around it.
